intro: Hygrophila microthamnia, commonly known as the small-leaved hygrophila, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, showcasing its adaptation to aquatic or semi-aquatic environments. It is often found in slow-moving waters and can thrive in both freshwater and brackish conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for water gardens and pond landscapes.
